Table of Contents

Interface IFeedService

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Services
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Service interface for RSS feed management operations. Provides comprehensive feed management with support for active/inactive filtering, health monitoring, and synchronization capabilities.

public interface IFeedService

Remarks

This service centralizes all feed-related business logic including:

  • Feed CRUD operations with active/inactive filtering
  • Feed refresh and synchronization with configurable intervals
  • Health monitoring with failure tracking and auto-disable
  • Category assignment and management
  • Article count tracking and retention policy enforcement

All methods return DTOs instead of entities to maintain separation of concerns. Implementations must ensure:

  • All read operations are memory-efficient using server-side filtering
  • Refresh operations respect feed-specific intervals to avoid overloading sources
  • Feed health monitoring automatically disables failing feeds after threshold
  • All operations support cancellation via CancellationToken

Methods

AddFeedAsync(CreateFeedDto, CancellationToken)

Adds a new feed to the system by parsing it from the provided URL.

Task<FeedDto> AddFeedAsync(CreateFeedDto createDto, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

createDto CreateFeedDto

The DTO containing feed creation data.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<FeedDto>

The newly created feed DTO with generated ID and metadata.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if createDto is null.

ArgumentException

Thrown if URL is invalid.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown when feed already exists or cannot be parsed.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

Task<bool> UpdateFeedRetentionAsync(int feedId, int? retentionDays, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

The feed identifier.

retentionDays int?

The new retention days (null for default).

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<bool>

True if the update succeeded; otherwise, false.

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if feedId is less than or equal to 0.

ArgumentException

Thrown if retentionDays is less than 1.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.
